result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin T. Saumier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
22CM407 and 22CM461 dismissed and read in. 
*78 days credit if revoked from Probation*

No contact with Kwik Trip, C.A., C.B., C.D., C.F., A.F., J.H., D.N. or C.V.

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM cases 22CF624, 22CM407, 22CM461 called. Defendant Benjamin T. Saumier in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Benjamin T. Saumier.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. There is an agreement which the State recites. Defendant was accepted into treatment court. 
In 22CF624: Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Information. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and orders anything else including 22CM407, 22CM461 and ride along traffic citations are dismissed and read in. 
Defense makes a statement before sentencing. Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 

Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
Successfully complete Branch 5 treatment court (already accepted).  
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.  
No Contact with Kwik Trip, C.A., C.B., C.D., C.F., A.F., J.H., D.N., & C.V. 
120 days in Jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Defendant to pay court costs including DNA sample surcharges. 
**78 days sentence credit if revoked from Probation**
Plea hearing on August 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:37 AM cases 22CF624, 22CM407, 22CM461 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin T. Saumier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Benjamin T. Saumier. In all files: Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. There is an agreement that contemplates treatment court- defendant has already applied to treatment court.  
A plea hearing is scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 2:00 PM (via zoom, 30 min).

2:08 PM Cases called: 22CF624, 22CM461 & 22CM407. Defendant Benjamin T. Saumier in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Benjamin T. Saumier. Parties are ready to proceed with the Preliminary Hearing. 

State calls Officer Nick Rusin, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies the defendant and the record will so reflect. 
Cross examination by Defense. 
Witness is excused.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. All cases are referred to Br. 3 for scheduling an arraignment.

(Case called at 11:19 AM)
Defendant Benjamin Saumier appears in custody via videoconference from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Katherine Cook.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense waives reading of the Complaint.  State requests $1,000 cash bond.  
Preliminary hearing: 6/14/2022 at 2:00 PM (all open cases to go in on this date)

Prior: Homeless, Eau Claire, WI

Conditions:
No contact with C.A., C.B., C.D., C.F., A.F., J.H., D.N., & C.V.

Routed to Defendant in the jail
